title: atan2 with cuda.DoubleTensor
body_html:
It seems that the operation "atan2" is not supported by PyTorch on cuda.DoubleTensor tensors.

There is a CUDA version of atan2 even for doubles

version 0.3.0.post4

MWE:

import torch
t = torch.cuda.DoubleTensor([1,3,4])
torch.atan2(t)

gives

TypeError                  Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-9-be88c1353778> in <module>()
----> 1 torch.atan2(t)

TypeError: Type torch.cuda.DoubleTensor doesn't implement stateless method atan2
body_text:

There is a CUDA version of atan2 even for doubles
version 0.3.0.post4
MWE:
import torch

body:
It seems that the operation "atan2" is not supported by PyTorch on cuda.DoubleTensor tensors.

There is a CUDA version of atan2 [even for doubles](http://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-math-api/group__CUDA__MATH__DOUBLE.html#group__CUDA__MATH__DOUBLE)

version `0.3.0.post4`

MWE:

```
import torch
t = torch.cuda.DoubleTensor([1,3,4])
torch.atan2(t)
```
gives 
```
TypeError                  Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-9-be88c1353778> in <module>()
----> 1 torch.atan2(t)

TypeError: Type torch.cuda.DoubleTensor doesn't implement stateless method atan2

```
